title: [$250] Remove “Switch to Classic” feedback survey for @expensify.com domain

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.35-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @coleaeason **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): #Convert ## Action Performed: ##Description: Expensify employees frequently switch between New Expensify (ND) and Classic (OD) as part of daily testing and support workflows. However, every time they click "Switch to Classic", they are forced to complete the feedback survey before being redirected. This creates unnecessary friction and slows down productivity. ##Request: Remove the "Switch to Classic" survey prompt entirely for any user with an @expensify.com email domain so switching platforms can be completed in one click. ## Expected Result: Users with @expensify.com email addresses should be redirected to Classic immediately—no survey shown. Flow should be one-click and frictionless. ## Actual Result: Every switch to Classic requires filling in a feedback survey. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

Add any screenshot/video evidence

title: [$50] Update Constant for View payment history

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
If you click View payment history in users accounts, it does always show you all your Expensify charges because the constant is to search for "Expensify, Inc." but at some point we were setting the merchant to "Expensify". So we need to update the search constant to just look for "Expensify" so it will show both versions.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.35-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @danielrvidal **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1760399942009119) ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: User1 and User2 are be on the same workspace 1. User2 sets up User1 as their copilot 2. User1 (via copilot access) comments on a report thread shared with User2 3. User2 mentions @User1 in the same thread 4. A system message appears stating User1 is not in the thread ## Expected Result: If a user has already commented in the thread—either directly or via copilot—they should be treated as part of the thread. No whisper message from Concierge should be shown when they are @mentioned. ## Actual Result: Whisper message from concierge displayed as User 1 isn't a member of this room ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Create new account without '+' 3. During the onboarding flow, select the intent "Manage my team's expenses" 4. Complete the onboarding flow with 'Explore all features' 5. Click 'Overview' in Workspace settings 6. Click 'Add a card' CTA ## Expected Result: User is redirected to the flow for adding a billing card ## Actual Result: User is redirected to adding billing card page, but then redirected again to admin room ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e599a785-9b22-4dea-bdbd-55e2ae974160 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: External

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.34-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1372/folder/13176710/41236938/962795958 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 10 / Chrome **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: 1. On a conversation, click on the + button in the compose box 2. Click on add attachment 3. Upload a Video 4. Click on the "Send" button. 5. Click on the play button and hover the mouse over the video. 6. Click on the three dots button -> Playback speed -> 0.25 7. Click on the full screen button. 8. Click on the three dots button -> Playback speed -> 0.75 9. Minimize the video. 10. Repeat step 6 and observe the selected playback speed. ## Expected Result: The playback speed should be updated to 0.75 speed selected in full screen mode. ## Actual Result: 0.25 speed still selected in the playback speed list after minimizing the video. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a2b1a00d-48e6-41ed-92e3-7e7bbd9de38a [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
